snippet: In expressing support for full-fledged casinos in New York, Mr. Cuomo is perhaps facing reality, but also pushing a notion that typically makes money off gamblers who don't have much to begin with.
abstract: In expressing support for full-fledged casinos in New York, Mr. Cuomo is perhaps facing reality, but also pushing a notion that typically makes money off gamblers who don't have much to begin with.
lead_paragraph: At about the same time that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo began his "State of the State" speech on Wednesday,  a middle-aged woman walked away from a slot machine called Great Wall in the new gambling hall adjoining Aqueduct racetrack. That machine had taken enough of her money for one day, said the woman, who preferred to keep her name to herself.

headline.main: Cuomo's Push for Casinos Not Good News for All Gamblers

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Resorts World Casino New York City
